qas.question: High altitude needs in Germany were going to be handled by what?
Who also collaborated in the design of the 75 mm gun?
Because higher performance was needed, Krupp's workers designed what?

answers.text: a new 88 mm design, the FlaK 36

qas.question: Where was the first place the FlaK 36 was used?
What war was the FlaK first used in?

context: Germany's high-altitude needs were originally going to be filled by <a0_0>a 75 mm gun from Krupp<a0_0/>, designed in collaboration with their Swedish counterpart <a1_0>Bofors<a1_0/>, but the specifications were later amended to require much higher performance. In response Krupp's engineers presented <a2_0>a new 88 mm design, the FlaK 36<a2_0/>. First used in <a3_0>Spain<a3_0/> during the <a4_0>Spanish Civil War<a4_0/>, the gun proved to be one of the best anti-aircraft guns in the world, as well as particularly deadly against light, medium, and even early heavy tanks.
